result.execSummary:
Donntrell Monte Harper was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Donntrell Monte Harper was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donntrell Monte Harper

records.addlTxt: Attorney Colleen Cullen appeared by video for Donntrell Monte Harper.  Attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has been turned over to the State of Illinois on 09/22/2022. On motion of the state, Court ordered case closed.

Defendant Donntrell Monte Harper not in court, defendant in custody.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status Conference held.  Defendant being held due to revocation revoked til  9.28.2022.  Court adjourns matter. Court continues Order that Defendant be REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Status conference scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Joel Alan Mogren in court, defendant Donntrell Monte Harper not in court, in custody.  Katrina Amy Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant awaiting an update from his probation officer. Court ordered another status to be set out for 30 days.  Status conference scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Donntrell Monte Harper in court with attorney Meera L Al-Henaey.  Defendant Donntrell Monte Harper in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Donntrell Monte Harper appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of rights and right to file a Writ of Habeas Corpus.  Court found the defendant is the person wanted in the State of ILLINOIS.  Defendant waived extradition.  Signed Waiver of Extradition received and filed.  Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/0a25f782-7319-dd31-4ed9-c0f452a2bc2b  Status conference scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
